snippet: The insurgency appeared positioned to take control of a highway that the government uses to supply troops.
abstract: Syria’s insurgency appears to make further territorial gains in country's south, with antigovernment activists saying rebels have seized military base near Dara’a, city where uprising against Pres Bashar al-Assad first began in March 2011.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and HALA DROUBI
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The insurgency appeared positioned to take control of a highway that the government uses to supply troops.

headline.seo: New Rebel Gains Reported in Southern Syria
headline.main: New Rebel Gains Reported in Southern Syria With Seizure of Military Base
headline.print_headline: New Rebel Gains Reported in Southern Syria With Seizure of Military Base
